name: Michigan State
blurb: This team is probably going to be a top 5 team in the country in January and people are going to be scratching their heads as to how that is possible.

name: Illinois
blurb: Top 3 roster in the sport. However, the best ability is availability.

name: Purdue
blurb: Braden Smith + TKR + Loyer gives you a hell of a floor but this team lacks an X-factor.

name: Wisconsin
blurb: Not a flashy roster but I'd put money on a top-4 finish.

name: Iowa
blurb: Bennet Stirtz is my darkhorse B10 POY if Braden Smith slips up.

name: Michigan
blurb: Dusty May could be potentially wasting away the best frontcourt in the country by not getting a stud PG in the portal. Yes, I know Elliot Cadeau exists.

name: Indiana
blurb: Being a competent team shooting the 3-point shot is a great way to not get boo'd off your home floor.

name: UCLA
blurb: Over/under on the Mick Cronin postgame interview eruptions this year is 6.

name: Washington
blurb: Danny Sprinkle finally has some expectations at the high major level. Can he deliver?

name: USC
blurb: I have zero clue what to think about this team.

name: Northwestern
blurb: This is a solid roster with the best coach in the conference (my opinion). Who will step up outside of Nick Martinelli is the million-dollar question.

name: Oregon
blurb: Jackson Shelstad is possibly the most valuable player in the conference because this team has looked god awful without him.

name: Nebraska
blurb: The natives in Lincoln are going to start to get restless if this team fails to make the tournament.

name: Ohio State
blurb: This team has some pieces but will Diebler get his team to overachieve for once?

name: Minnesota
blurb: Niko Medved needs time. See if you can ride Cade Tyson to a solid finish and maybe finally recruit some players from the state?

name: Maryland
blurb: Will be a bit tough to watch offensively this year. However, will probably beat Illinois by double digits.

name: Penn State
blurb: Big fan of Kayden Mingo but that's about it.

name: Rutgers
blurb: This roster is..yikes. Pikiell should firmly be on the hot seat.
